item.title: Decorator Design Pattern
item.description: Reference: Topics: Summary The decorator design pattern allows behaviour to be added to an object, either statically or dynamically, without affecting the behaviour of other objects from the same class.

item.title: Observer Design Pattern
item.description: Reference: Topics: summary The ‘Observer’ design pattern is a behavioural design pattern that allows an object, known as the subject, to automatically notify it’s observers (other objects) about any changes to it’s state.

item.title: Single Design Pattern
item.description: Reference: Topics: Summary Is a type of creational pattern that ensures a class has only one instance and provides global access to this instance.

item.title: Strategy Design Pattern
item.description: Reference: Topics: Summary The strategy design pattern is a behavioural design pattern that allows you to define a ‘family’ of algorithms, encapsulate each one, and make them interchangeable.
